I just wish I had eaten less beforehand so I could have eaten more of my meal (seared rare fish isn't as good microwaved).  My wine was good, our server was good...a little timid at times, but that was fine. We like to play around a little at dinner...I like a server who can hold their own, but all in all, a great special occasion dinner. It was a little pricey, but it's the Waterfront.   ***DISCLAIMER: TREEHUGGER***I will say, they lost a star really only for having a selection of fish that was mostly on my ECO-WORST list! Fish is a tricky business lately. I will spare you the environmental lecture & just leave you with this: restaurants (especially in areas not close to the source) buy fish as cheaply as possible, which usually means fish that are dwindling in population (Chilean sea bass, etc) or collected in the wrong ways that kill other marine life or damage ecosystems (many kinds of tuna,etc). Just ask where your the fish you're ordering comes from. If the server doesn't know or obviously makes something up...you're in trouble anyway.

Ambiance /aesthetics of the restaurant are average at best; it lacks elegance and distinction. That is not a problem of course if food and service are outstanding, but that is not the case here.  The service was adequate but our waiter was not knowledgeable about the menu (or food and beverages in general) and hence unable to make useful recommendations. If he was still in training, one would expect him to be accompanied by a more seasoned colleague - that would be the norm for a restaurant serving fare in this price range.   One of our party ordered the sea bass (after reading rave reviews about it here on Yelp) and although it was served on top of a tasty broth, the fish itself was completely flavorless. The chef would be wise to pour that broth over the fish while cooking.  The lobster bisque was highly mediocre (for a great lobster bisque, try A Different Pointe of View at Pointe Hilton), and the blue cheese in both the olives in my martini (brought to the table the first time with a lemon twist by the way, even though the cocktail menu specifically listed it as a blue-cheese stuffed olive martini) and as well on the wedge salad, was simply too pungent. Cheese that intense destroys enjoyment of other flavors. What can be done with blue cheese that is overpowering? Mix it with a milder cheese. But our overall impression was that no one is tasting the food before sending it out at Wildfish. And clearly no one is taking the time to fully develop the wait staff.   * A note again regarding our waiter and the cocktails at this restaurant... Our server had clearly received little to no training and lacked even a basic familiarity with fine dining concepts. He actually offered to leave the martini with the lemon twist at our table and simply return with olives. And I had ordered it "slightly dirty!" LOL! Worse: the martini he did bring back, while bearing the correct garnish, was among the worst blue cheese olive martinis I have ever tasted.  I will say that the lobster tail was good for Phoenix (difficult to find truly sweet, tender lobster here) but that alone is not enough to compensate for the myriad issues we experienced. For the price, I can't recommend this restaurant.

First off, I am sorry that it has taken me so long to write this review.  I visited Wildfish on two occasions this past Spring. I love the ambiance and vibe of the restaurant.  The whole staff is so warm, friendly and professional.  The food is great too! I recall having a steak, steamed vegetables and a salad.  Everything was perfect and delicious.  My friend and I felt so special because the General Manger, Mr. Damon Hovannisian came over and spoke with us. He wanted to ensure that we were receiving good service and that our food was good . . .everything was great!  I like this restaurant for so many different reasons, one plus is the parking. There is plenty of free parking very close to the restaurant; I also like the location right in the heart of Old Town. This a great place for first dates or any event.  I will be back soon.

This review if for their happy hour because that's all that I've experienced.  Love that they have happy hour all night on Sundays and Mondays.  I live close by and used to frequent Wildfish often for happy hour.  I usually get the crab cake and lobster bisque.

Happy hour at Wildfish a nice way to do it.  $2 off drinks, about $3-$5 off a number of small plates and appetizers, and a few entrees.  The calamari appetizers is my favorite anyplace - too large for one unless you treat it as an entree, lots of nice fried calamari, rice noodles, julienne veggies with a nice, moderately spicy sauce.  Salad selections at happy hour also terrific - apple and greens and a nice shrimp salad. My wife enjoyed her two fish tacos.  You can order off main menu as well, and do we shared lobster bisque - very good. Only ordering off the happy menu (plus bisque) was plenty of food, especially with the bread basket.
I went to this restaurant and I was not that impressed. I ordered the Chilean sea bass and it was quite bland! The happy hour isn't bad but they need to season their food a bit more!

Hostess with the leastest...  We walked in at 1040 last night (closing time is 11) only to be told by the hostess that the everything would be shut down at 11pm and that's what her manager told her to say.  So, I say 1 star!  You're open until 11pm unless someone wants to eat I guess.
Crab stuffed grilled shrimp and bananas foster...WOW.  You can come here in a suit or jeans.  Great bar and fantastic wine selection.
Stopped in to celebrate with a treat. Lobster bisque is great, also had 2 9oz lobster tails, pricy but cooked to perfection. Service is perfect, atmosphere is great, pop music did not seem to fit.

Maybe it was an off day for the chef...but our food was incredibly underwhelming. Only one person in our group said they enjoyed their meal, but caveated that it wasn't special, just "good."  Not impressive given how expensive Wildfish is - one would expect much higher levels of satisfaction.  I started with the crab and corn chowder, which was flavorless and surprisingly very watery.  I would think the smoked bacon would have added some depth to the soup, but it didn't appear there was any bacon in the chowder.  Needless to say, we had 8 people in our party and I passed the bowl around...there was still at least half of the chowder left - no one wanted a second taste.  I had the Seared Pacific Ahi tuna for my entree. Cooked fine at rare. However, the star of the dish was the side - the mango salad. It was bright, citrus-y and a great complement to the slab of tuna next to it.  Others in our party had the following and universally shrugged their shoulders in indifference when asked how they enjoyed their meal:  Scottish Salmon (my dad), Shrimp and Crab chopped salad (my mom), Scallops (my sister & brother), Filet Mignon & Crab (my best friend - he did say he enjoyed his steak), Jumbo Gulf Shrimp (my wife), and Halibut (my brother-in-law).  We also ordered a couple of sides:  the Crab fried rice - overwhelmingly salty. I couldn't eat a 2nd bite. We were all very surprised how salty it was.  I was told this was my brother and sister's favorite dish - they even noted it was saltier than usual.  Also ordered the truffled mac & cheese and parmesan & chives french fries - both were ok.  Would very much like to come back since it appears that it's typically a very good place for seafood.  But for the price, I'm reluctant to spend that much money again for a 2nd chance.  Service was very good and attentive overall.  Our waiter forgot the mac & cheese originally, but comped us for the mishap.

I love this restaurant! This place is a solid 4 stars. I came here for happy hour with my friend and husband and I sure did leave happy (full and happy)!   Pro:  - fresh oysters  - clean ingredients  - clean and appetizing presentation of food  - beautiful ambiance, a very chill environment  - reasonable prices! This is very important to me.  - their fish never smell fishy   Cons:  - the portions for their dinner menu are smaller in portion size.  - a very limited drink options for happy hour   Service:  - fast  -friendly  - the servers dress up in their tux vests. It gives the service a very upscale and classy vibe.  - very accommodating servers and bartenders - manager checks in with you during their dinner service  Overall, I recommend this place because of their pronominal service and fresh seafood.  Please let me know if you have any questions about this place!

We hit this place after a long day of shopping.  I liked this place.  I am always seeking out seafood options and there are many here.  The tuna tartar could have used more flavor.  The sea bass was buttery and served in a delicate white wine sauce....really good.  There are so many things that looked good on the menu, I will be back again to try something new.
What a wonderful time at Wildfish tonight!  The bartenders treated us so special in honor of my friends birthday!  Free dessert and birthday shot!
5 Stars  One Dish  Chilean Sea bass Steamed "Hong Kong Style" with Soy, Sherry and Ginger  Thats it!

Came here for Happy Hour and it was excellent. I had flavored $5 martinis, 75-cent oysters (which were amazingly fresh), 1/2 off their meaty, lumpy crabcakes and 1/2 off a gigantic plate of calamari. They don't open until 4:00 pm and that is my only drawback - that I can't sit there all day gorging myself and getting hammered...

Just had to kill some time before catchin' the flight back to Denver, and was explicit about having only drinks. The empty restaurant-- at 4pm-- would not accommodate sitting four of us at any location, even one that was reserved for, say, 6pm and we had a flight to catch and would bounce if someone showed up an hour early.  Equally inflexible was their short happy hour menu, not offering anything veggie for my conference-friend who didn't eat meat (and who wholly loathes reservations as an Australian; I wanted to include many, many lines and anecdotes of his, but...)  Finally, my barman-- nice guy-- kept offering things they were out of, like rose wine. I also wasn't really feelin' how we were both hyped they offered a gluten-free vodka so I could enjoy the $6 happy hour martini, but my man brings a check with a regular $12 martini (or three); this was Tito's, yo-- it's $20 a bottle and nobody ain't foolin' nobody.  Best line from she-beaux: "Ill-fitting white jackets: kill me."  I got the feeling this was a place that wants and/or attracts a certain clientele-- take a casual walk by first and have a gander in; you'll know it when you see it.

Desiring a good meal and preferring seafood, our VALET recommended Wildfish . . . Great recommendation! The Chilean Sea Bass was almost as good as to what I'm accustomed, the calamari appetizer was excellent. I had struggled with the mediocre meals we had experienced in Scottsdale, but this did not disappoint. The meals were a little more pricey, but considering everything is flown in fresh - you get what you pay for! Along with great food, the ambience was romantic, quiet, relaxing and our waiter was professional and hospitable. They do no have a "children's menu", but they do have a few select items for children plus they will tailor any of their menu items for their younger patrons.

I just relocated here but have already been to Wildfish twice in the past 2 weeks, The food is fresh, very well prepared and there are quite a few nice selections on the menu. What I appreciate the most is the service. The restaurant and bar are crowded and energetic, yet the service still feels very personal. Jorge was efficient, knowledgable, but most of all genuine and friendly. Made for a great dining experience.   This will be at the top of our list for dining with friends & visitors.

Classic Scottsdale locale - near a mall, full of Large breasted (surgically enhanced) Cougars, full of spoiled 20-year-olds, pretty good and overpriced seafood.  They have a packed and fun happy hour with good deals.  What's not to love?

Fish in the desert is a tricky proposition. You're going to pay more for quality and that's what happens up at Wildfish. It's pricey but solid food.  If you're in the area around happy hour time they do have some great apps and drinks on special.  The service was terrific.  The only thing that bothered me was how tight everything was.  If you're at the bar there is constant traffic behind you people cluttered around to order.

This place is LEGIT! The whole experience was perfect. The atmosphere (at night at least) is definitely a place for a romantic evening. The lighting is dim, music playing was jazz, the service was A+ and the FOOD....Bomb! lol   We started with some martinis and ordered crab cakes, which was ALL CRAB. Next we had some oysters. For our main course we had the Sea Bass (Hong Kong style) and the halibut (over cooked pork shank) - both these dishes which were recommended, were perfect. We ended our meal with some Creme Brulee.   Great place, will be coming again for another special occasion.

Nice atmosphere and plenty of delicious meals.  The happy hour is awesome....one of the best calamari I have tried as well as their crab cakes.  Great drink specials and the staff is also very friendly.
The food, service, and atmosphere were impeccable! Even the water was exceptional! My husband had lobster tails that were the best I'd ever tasted. The crab fried rice is a must-try!

1) eat on the patio 2) bring your appetite The lobster tacos are fabulous. The sea bass is great it's a perfect piece of fish and they prepare it nicely without trying to overwhelm you they let the fish stand on its own as they should. I would love to try the black cod but it has mushrooms which I abhor so it's not in the cards. The crab fried rice was a little overdone. The Mac and cheese was yummy the lobster mashed are to die for. The calamari was great but there isn't much on the plate but it's in a yummy Kung Pao sauce. The filet was sooooooo good which you don't always expect knowing that this isn't a steak house it's a fish house. I didn't really try any desserts but  he recommend the bananas foster.

Since moving back to the Valley of the Sun, I have had a hard time finding both good and fresh seafood. It's one of the few things my little heart is broken over since leaving LA. Traffic on the 405 nope, don't miss that a bit... The better than thou attitudes and the plastic LA scene, nope, can't say I miss that either... But having access to super fresh seafood is something this girl misses... ALOT!  So last night when this chick was craving some fresh oysters and fantastic seafood... I was at a loss as to where to go, that was until Wildfish Seafood Grille was suggested. I thought sure, why not, haven't been there but frankly wasn't expecting to be wowed. Made a quick reservation through open table on my trusty Yelp app on my iphone and off we were to Wildfish!   Once we arrived we were greeted by 3 super friendly hostesses and were promptly sat in a comfortable booth, Our server Charles was quick to the table to take our drink order and was both knowledgable of the menu but also friendly, funny and engaging and was never too intrusive during our meal. It's rare that you find both good food and service so out of this world that it makes you want to go back and dine there every night of the week, but Wildfish delivered the good food and Charles delivered the stellar service!   We started off with a dozen oysters, which were fresh and delicious. Only complaint was that there were a few chunks of shells in several of my oysters but it happens. I can't wait to come back for more delicious and fresh oysters ASAP!   Being torn between 3 different entrees, I looked to Charles for his suggestion. He suggested (The Sea bass) and boy he was seriously just spot on. The Chilean Sea Bass is steamed Hong Kong Style served in a light soy broth. The fish was not only super fresh, but it was cooked to perfection and the soy broth perfectly balanced the dish. It would be hard to ever go there and order a different entree after eating that! They had a scallop dish that was a special that particular evening and they were smaller scallops served with roasted grapes, that dish was also quite delicious and I thought the grapes were an interesting addition. We ordered two small sides, The Brussels sprouts and the sautéed spinach, both good but the Brussels Sprouts were the real standout. We finished off our meal with their delicious bananas foster butter cake with butter pecan ice cream ( I think I died and went to sugar coma heaven) .  So moral of this story is this.... Go to Wildfish Seafood and Grille, make sure Charles is your server, order the oysters (if your into that kind of thing!) and get the Chilean Sea Bass and don't skip desert!

This was my first time eating here. We had reservations for a group of us and was able to get seated right away.   The tables are quite close to each other. However the servers and wait staff were great! Very friendly.   Now.. For the food... The menu is slim pickings, seemed like there were more appetizers and sides than main entrees and dishes. This made it a little difficult for me to decide on a main course, but I went with the 22 ounce ribeye steak and ordered half dozen oysters to start.  Because the steak is "a la cart" I had to get sides separately. For my side I ordered sauté spinach.   The steak was pricy however, it lacked spice and was not as tasty as other nice places. The spinach was on point and delicious.  Now the oysters were absolutely amazing! It was big, meaty, and had no odor or fish like smell! It was so fresh!   We also shared the Steak and Lobster Tar Tar and the Yellowtail Sashimi. The Sashimi was great! The tar tar was ok. The Tartare Of Pacific Ahi Tuna probably would have been a better choice. Well maybe next time.   All in all it was a good experience. Good dining.
I went the Wildfish Seafood Grill for a Scottsdale Chamber of Commerce Event. I was blown away how good the food and service was.  I will certainly go back !!!

Very nice place for dinner. The perfect margarita was definitely perfect! And the lemon sole was delicious. We got a side (small) of the Brussel sprouts which were excellent and the swordfish with crab was perfectly light but filling.

I love this place. It isn't too hard to get into on a Friday night, but the food is among the best in old Scottsdale. One great way to tell is their Heirloom Tomato salad.  Even the best restaurants have a tough time using flavorful ripe tomatoes, but I have had the dust each of the last two times I visited and the they were spectacular.  The oysters always taste fresh which is another tough test to consistently pass. The sea bass honk Kong style was incredible.  Go to this restaurant before it gets too busy to  to make plans at the last minute.  It should be a lot busier that it is!!!

I had the most amazing experience of my life here tonight. I cannot believe a seafood place has the worlds most amazing steak. It was a filet Minot like nothing I've had in my life all over Canada and the states. You haven't lived until you've had the filet and lobster meal here. Start with an oyster or two and you will have the most amazing night of your life

I wondered if this place was new having only one review - I was quite pleased I gave it a shot  last night.  came here with my colleague but this would be a great date spot.  classy. great service. I had the swordfish steak topped with crab. it was awesome. as was my colleague's Chilean sea bass. also had the chocolate lava cake with ice cream that was fairly amazing. (it should be, it was Nat'l Dessert Day! or so I was told.)  I ordered an old fashioned. I've had better. my colleague had the lobster bisque. she wiped the bowl clean with her bread - it was that good.  you should go here. with a date. and your wallet.

Every time I'm out in Phoenix, I HAVE to stop off at Wildfish Seafood Grille for dinner.  I had the Wildfish Chopped Salad with Crab and Shrimp and it was delicious.  I also ordered the small truffle mac and cheese and bacon shallot brussel sprouts and both were very good too.  Great service and great food!

I liked Wild Fish, and I would go back.  However, it didn't rock my world.  Corporate bullshit, ya know.  I would never call the place trendy, it's in a strip mall and has little personality.  The service was not remarkable, the wait was too long.  But, in the end, my meal was quite good.  The fish was cooked perfectly and the portions were impressive.  Skip the dessert and go elsewhere.  A bit pricey but that shouldn't be a deterant.

Dude...a happy hour that is TRULY happy!!!    This joint is relatively swank for all the deals it has.  Nice decor, good bar, FRESH seafood (seriously...this is some good quality).  Starting at 4:00 p.m., they have $5 martinis AND $0.75 oysters.  YUM!  On top of that, they offer discounts on other appetizers such as the bread and cheese plate, a GIANT crab cake, a salads, and shrimp dishes.  All are tasty.  For all the Zoners out there (yeah, I said it), you have to check out this place.  You will have a great time!   NOTE - beware of dirty old men.  They'll hit on your friends!

Stopped by for a light dinner and drinks on a Thursday night.   Seated immediately and served some warm bread.  Drinks were great and didn't skimp on the alcohol.   We ordered a half dozen of the premium oysters and they were awesome.  Worth every penny.   The horseradish that came with them was really, really, really great.  Had to try the lobster bisque based on other reviews.   It was very good.  Not the best I've had, but very creamy and filling.      Service was top notch.   Manager even stopped by to see how things were and chat.  I would eat here again without hesitation.

4 guys hanging out for Tuesday Happy hour which to our great surprise was all night long!!! Service, food, prices, ambiance, and overall restaurant experience was fantastic!!! Would definately be back!!!

I have visited this establishment numerous times, along with friends or family.  And NEVER have I ever had a bad experience!  From entering to exiting, and everything in between, has always been fabulous and extremely customer-service oriented!  A friend took me for my birthday (her first visit), and  Eric and Pat made it a birthday for my black velvet box of great memories!  They both made me feel like I was the Queen and a Princess.  The drinks were superb, the food was out-of-this-world, with the best service to boot!    After eating appetizers, salad, and the main dish which was their delectable crabcake I was so full!  When I felt the best exit would be to roll, not walk out of there, they bring me the best dessert, banana foster,  with candle and song!  Just the right touch to top off an already memorable evening!    Wildfish is great!  And Eric and Pat is GREATER!!!

Yes, five stars!  First review and I thought I'd make it a good one.    From start to finish a fantastic experience.  The fish is *so* fresh and perfectly prepared.  My friend had a bone in filet - best steak we've ever had.  Just done to perfection.    The ambiance is nice - definitely upscale and vibrant.  And once it cools down a bit, I cannot wait for the patio to get going.    Great job Wildfish, I will definitely be back!

A very solid sea food restaurant, classed up in the dark classy Scottsdale ambiance that you'd expect.   Prices are high (it's a sea food restaurant), but the food is worth it.  Wildfish is a place I've wanted to try for quite a while, and thanks to an excellent Restaurant Week menu, I finally did.  We had the spicy tuna roll.  With avocado, cucumber, and cilantro, it came together quite nicely.  It's not something that would take me away from a regular sushi bar, but certainly a perfect appetizer.  Asian barbecue steelhead trout.  The fish was cooked perfectly.  I enjoyed the sauce.  It had a great kick, but it tasted much more american barbecue than asian.  We also went off the restaurant week menu and had lemon sole.  This was one nice fish.  We finished the restaurant week selection with vanilla bean creme brûlée.  This is was an unfortunate miss.  It was hot.  Creme brûlée is supposed to be made in advanced, cooled off, then the top is torched.  This was warm all the way through.  The peanut butter cookie that came with it was tasty, but did not compliment the dish any further.  Not at all what I was hoping for.  Other than the disappointing dessert, it was an all around great dining experience.  The service is wonderful.  The staff is very friendly, and plates were cleared and drinks were refilled very quickly.  I should also mention that the bread we received before the appetizer was straight out of the oven, hot!  The cold butter melted right on it.

Just finished dinner at Wildfish. We were going to go to Citizen Public House but that required a 30 minute wait for a table or sitting at the bar. Which would have been okay if the restaurant wasn't so noisy. Wildfish was our backup and we were very happy to end up there. Tuna tartar appetizer was excellent, followed by halibut in a lemon butter sauce. The fish was perfectly prepared, moist and flakey. We splurged on the twice baked potato, which was excellent as well. We enjoyed it so much we made reservations for Friday. Best fish and meal we've had in Scottsdale so far. Service was very excellent.

Delicious food with excellent service. We came here with a group of 13 girls with reservations, were seated promptly, and they took our orders for apps to share.   By the time we got our drinks, the apps also came out. We shared the dumplings, calamari, and truffle mac and cheese. The calamari was a bit on the salty side because of the sauce that covered it.   I had the Chilean sea bass as my entree and it was delicious. The price was steep at $45 but the fish melted in my mouth! One of the best Chilean sea bass dishes I've ever had.

We used to love this place, but the staff seemed to have turned over recently as the service was very very slow. Food was also just so/so. Lobster came out raw. May rethink coming back after 5+ years of this being our favorite spot.

Was on a break at work at 3pm two days ago considering Wildfish for happy hour, so I called first to see if I could speak w/ a kitchen manager or chef re food allergies and soon was speaking to sous chef Matt.  Since I've had happy hour (1/2 off select apps) there before- I've not had the pleasure of having dinner, yet- I already knew I loved the All Lump Crabcake (reg. $14.95) and the Crispy Cashew Calamari ($12.95?).  Knowing that many Asian recipes use * I asked Matt if the calamari salad contained any (I recalled that the salad had * as a garnish) - the answer was yes.  That left me w/ the crabcake.  Did Wildfish use ** in preparation?  No on the *, but yes on the * (the remoulade that came w/ the crabcake also contained *), but if I were to call in the morning and let them know I was going to have dinner there, he'd be able to make a batch of *-free crabcake and remoulade.  I lamented that I was actually going to head over there at 4p, but... Immediately, Matt said he'd have a special batch ready for me, no problem (!!).  I also spotted Maine lobster bisque on the online menu and had asked Matt if roux or * was used as a thickener (if *, then I couldn't have it), but, like most quality restaurants, Wildfish uses only roux.  Upon hearing this tidbit, I was excited and looking forward to having a bowl of bisque, the crabcake app, and a glass of cabernet!  As soon as I walked into the restaurant, I was warmly accosted by the host, who informed me that I could sit anywhere I wanted.  I asked her if I could speak with Matt and was told he'd be informed I was there.  While I waited, I perused through the menu and found that BV Signet chardonnay, merlot, and cab sauvignon were the select wines selling for $5 a glass during happy hour, so I chose the cab.  I also ordered a bowl of the lobster bisque.  A few minutes passed by, my delicious cab arrived (I love the wine glasses there!), and soon I was speaking to Matt in person, who must have spent at least 20 minutes w/ me (in addition to the time he spent on the phone w/ me earlier) throughout my time there looking over the menu and seeing which items I could try and which were off-limits.  It's so refreshing to know that there are restaurants who have staff who are willing to take the time to listen to their customers and be willing to tweak their recipes so that people w/ food issues may still enjoy many menu options.  I was happy to learn that afternoon, that most, if not all, the seafood dishes could be adjusted, either by leaving off one or more ingredients, or by substituting a different sauce (which many restaurants are unwilling to do, it seems- something to do w/ quality control) or vegetable side.  The topic of desserts came up soon enough, so for those with corn allergies, you'll be happy to know that the Cinnamon-raisin bread pudding and Hot chocolate Godiva cake, as well as the Hot apple & cinnamon cobbler (minus the ice cream- it contains corn syrup) and Creme brulee (minus the cookies- they contain baking powder, but don't worry, he'll substitute fresh berries, instead!) are SAFE TO ENJOY.  I of course adored the special crabcake Matt prepared for me- I confess I was so smitten by it, that I had TWO crabcake dishes (Matt was gracious enough to whip up another batch for me!) along w/ the table bread and butter.  I must mention that as I was sipping a few tablespoonsfuls of the bisque, Matt stopped by to let me know that it contained a couple of ingredients I mentioned needing to avoid, so he promptly took the soup out of my sight.  No worries, though, as this left me more room for that second crabcake!  (Sadly, I did exhibit allergy symptoms all day Wednesday...)  (Hope you enjoy the photos.  Love that ice mountain adorned with shellfish!  FYI, fresh-shucked oysters are 50c during happy hour!!)

This is a clear five star experience.  We just got off of a 10 cruise.  Where food is everything.  This place was so good. I had the sword fish. It was the best fish I have had ever.  The service was excellent.  The banana foster was the best imaginable. My wife had a chicken dish, she commented full of flavor.   This is far better than other restaurant in this location. The portion was adequate serving.

Don't you love it when you walk into a place, and the bar is situated so everyone can't help but notice the sudden burst of daylight, eclipsed by the shadowy figure that is you? The door closes behind you, they're still looking.  What are they looking at you wonder. Didn't they have moms who taught them it wasn't polite to stare? Yet they do, and now you're uncomfortable.  Mom always said the only reason people stare is if you're really attractive or really repulsive.  Thanks mom...like that helps right now.   You take a seat at the bar, order your drink, and begin to look around while settling in.  And this is the point where you realize how you've just entered some sort of twilight zone where only beautiful people exist.  Even the old people are beautiful.   Two stars for the hostess not turning me away.  This isn't the place for torn 501's, black Chuck Taylor's, and a t-shirt with 96 bold font reading  "Excuse me...you're standing on my penis."  This is the place where people look as though they've just fallen out of a page from Marie Claire, or Esquire.  Not Guns and Ammo.  May I suggest the one-dollar oysters and several beers with which to wash the slimy shites down? I know, you hate oysters...right?  Me too.   The oysters are necessary however in this situation, as they demonstrate your culinary prowess, negating your lack of fashion, raising you up a few pegs...going from classless mook to eccentric cool guy. And all for a buck each, go figure.  The many, many beers provide goggles. Also needed to help gravitate your fellow pub-goers down a few pegs...to your level. At least in your mind anyway.  Once the playing field is level, now you can strike up a conversation with Miss Thing who's seated next to you. I hope she can read my shirt.

Oysters are to die for! We got half a dozen and loved them so much, we got another! Also, their yellowtail is so good! Their wine list is so large and has my favorite on there. I cannot wait to go again!

Food = 5 Service = 0  I was in town with a group of friends last weekend.  We walked in an checked in under our reservation.  We were told that they were getting the table ready and it would be just a few minutes...and then they forgot about us.  When we glanced outside, we could see our table, all ready and waiting for us - such a tease!  We we re-checked-in with the SAME hostess, she gave me a blank look and asked if I had checked in - painful!  Once we were seated, we had to hunt down wait staff to take our orders.  Then we waited for our food...and waited...and waited.  THANKFULLY, one of my friends caught wind of some commotion next to our table when they had brought our our entrees.  Apparently, they forgot to bring out our salads so they were going to bring our entrees back to the kitchen (presumable to sit under heat lamps) so that we could have our salads.  She stepped in and let them know that we would be a-ok without the salads.  To be fair they offered us ONE free dessert.  Once we had our food, it was all incredible.  I tried bites of everyone's dinners and the sea bass, scallops, and butterfish were remarkably wonderful.  We also enjoyed our complimentary bread pudding for dessert.

OMG. This place is fantastic. The fish is so fresh and well prepared. Service is amazing and the drinks are perfectly made. If you are looking for a great fish restaurant you can't lose with Wildfish.
My favorite restaurant ever!  And I actually mean my absolute #1 favorite!  Great Happy Hour!  Be careful though, it is a Cougar Den...

If I could eat seafood every day for the rest of my life I would die happy, so I am always looking for new seafood places to try.    Being a landlocked desert state known for their Mexican food it is hard to find a seafood place that I am able to find the courage to try.  The crab cakes were outstanding and the ambience just added to the experience.  I had the Ahi tuna which was good and my girlfriend had the swordfish which was great!    The place is in a hip area of Scottsdale and the only negative part of the evening was when the Manager came up to greet us at our table I found out it was my girlfriend's ex boyfriend.  Probably wont go on any more dates there but definitely want to go back and try happy hour...maybe with my brother.

The only thing I would come back to this place is on Sunday, for their happy hour (all day) for some raw oysters, a bit of Fuji apple salad (just to have some greens for the day), and perhaps the crab cake if bf is tagging along.  Please don't get their calamari. It's the worst calamari I've had in my life, flavor-less, breading coat was too thick, and seriously, you can't mix everything with ginger sauce and call it Asian fusion. The fish dishes were alright, but honestly I've had better.  Service wasn't that attentive either, and it wasn't a very crowded night.

Five stars, all the way. Five star staff... our server was incredibly attentive and accomodating, which is wonderful when you make the fantastically inappropriate decision to dine at a seafood restaurant with a vegetarian and a person who hates fish. She made sure we were not just happy, but ecstatic with our wine choices by bringing over various tastes from their lengthy wines by the glass list.   They graciously serve oysters (two different kinds) in any denomination, so if you're craving 'em but don't want to order a bunch (or if you really want someone to try them... and you should, the blue tips were A-MAZ-ING), you don't have to... you can just get one.  The cashew calamari was impressively tender, and no having to deal with the little baby squid guys with their tentacles and so on. It's all fresh and fileted length-wise, then battered and fried. Delish.  The servers all wear white jackets (it's an appreciated touch) and mill about quickly and efficiently. The place is so large that you sometimes forget that the other side of the wine cellar boasts a rather bustling bar. The chairs are wonderfully comfortable. The lights are high, like the designers were exalting the space and celebrating the high ceilings. The experiential fountain pillars out front are disarming, as are the textured French doors. The whale bone-esque structure over the bar is a clever design element, feeding the eastern thought that restaurants are, indeed, where you enter the belly so as to feed the belly.  I will be back here again and again.

Stopped in here for Happy Hour after a shopping trip to Nordstrom , what a fun Happy Hour and the dishes were wonderful! we had the lobster and steak tartare and the chilled shrimp cocktail. Both of these appetizers were so yummy! The ambiance is dark and sexy, the back bar has a large ice display with lobster and King crab legs displayed . The bar was absolutely packed! We will definitely be back to try out this spot for dinner.

This restaurant has the most wonderful seafood! We all loved everything we ordered. The service was great! Andrew made us feel so comfortable and Chef Michelle was wonderful at making sure we loved our food. It was a memorable evening.

I have been eating at Wildfish since it opened and after my most recent Saturday evening dining experience, I must say, the quality of both the food and service have gone way downhill.   I know....a busy Saturday night and so, perhaps I should give both the servers and chef a break? Sorry. The menu has changed and so has the quality of food - and not in a good way. Let me just give you a brief sample of our experience - the Ahi Tuna Tartare appetizer has been changed to a lackluster combination of flavors. The idea of tuna with mango seems lovely however there is a total and complete blandness to the way this dish is now served. The former tuna appetizer was far more tempting. Moving onto the Goat Cheese Medallion Arugula salad. My salad was served sans medallion and literally laden with a huge glob of cold goat cheese and some terribly prepared mushrooms. What happened to the warm, crusted goat cheese? Next, we both ordered the Parmesan Crusted Sole. While the sole was prepared well, I do not recall this dish having a cream based sauce in the past. If memory serves me well, the dish should have had a lemon sauce delicately balancing the flavor of the fish. Cream and sole do not make a happy pair!  I am not sure if this was an error or part of the new menu. Okay, and for the piece de resistance we ordered a side of the Sugar Snap Peas which were actually drowning in a bath of some kind of soy and oil sauce. It actually made me ill to eat it - and my companion, as well.   Our service was slow and unattentive - although I do realize service can be a very personal experience.   I was sick with food poisoning all day Sunday - as if the poorly prepared food were not enough to bring down my joy.   So, I caution those of you who may have once enjoyed this restaurant like me - think twice before dropping a pretty penny at Wildfish.

2.5, just not enough to give it three.   Food was just OK and they ran out of ahi tuna by 9pm!   They have happy hour all night (pretty good specials too) but they close SO early (10pm last call on Sunday)!

Great service but the food left me desiring a meal elsewhere. My husband and I really enjoyed the bar staff as well as our server once we sat down for dinner. The people were fantastic but the food wasn't good at all. We started with a crabcake at the bar. It fell apart easily and lacked flavor. Once seated for dinner, I ordered scallops and my husband had grouper. We also shared a side of the truffle mac and cheese. My entree came with 5 scallops and was paired with citrus flavors. I ate a scallop and a half, and just couldn't do it anymore. The scallops weren't caramelized and they tasted like water. I understand what they were going for with the citrus, but it wasn't executed properly. Worst scallops I've ever had.. My husbands grouper was exceptionally small and very over salted. The lemon sauce it was paired with also had a water taste. The grouper was extremely dry.   On a positive note, the bread was good.. :)  I wouldn't recommend this restaurant. Good service from waitstaff can only get you

Great decor, food, drinks and staff.  We started our dinner with oysters (all very good) and Crispy Salt and Pepper Shrimp (with Ginger, Red Chiles and Sugar Snap Peas) - so good!  I can't remember what exactly we ordered, but it was all really good. My fiance & I had two different kinds of salads while his sister & her fiance had some kind of fish (also very good). The portions are bigger than what I had expected. I do remember ordering the Parmesan and Chives French Fries which I recommend ordering.

Sadly, my experience at Wildfish this evening was extremely disappointing, due in large part to the total ineptitude of our waiter. He was well meaning and very pleasant (apologizing each time he messed up) but his lack of training was appalling. To specify: (1) he forgot to bring the wine we ordered, (2) forgot to order one of our side dishes so that it came a full ten minutes after our meal was served, and then (3), left the dirty dishes in front of us even while pouring our coffee. The food was fine, which is the only reason this received 2 stars rather than 1.  But it could not compensate for such bad service. It certainly wasn't worth the cost of this dinner.

This place rocks.   I've done happy hour here a few times and the atmosphere, quality of service and food is great.  Just recently we celebrated a birthday here on a Wednesday evening  and again the experience didn't disappoint.   Service was top notch and the food was remarkable.  Being a Wednesday night and during a monsoon storm didn't do wonders for the business that night but maybe it helped with the service.  Reviews abound for this place, so I'll just stick with our specifics.   Our party of 3 started with 9 gulf oysters and a crab cake, chased down with a top-shelf cosmo, glass of wine, and a mojito. The mojito was deceptively strong as it should be and the crab cake was easily top ten - the remoulade with it was very tasty.  Oysters were fresh shucked with horseradish and cocktail.  For the mains - Australian lobster tails, scallops, and sea bass. Absolutely amazing - every dish looked, smelled, and tasted perfect.  The lobster tails were the star of this show - that's what the birthday girl ordered. The server said Australian tails are typically sweeter than Maines, albeit a little smaller, and he wasn't lying - they were oh so sweet and succulent.  The sea bass is steamed in an oriental fashion and the scallops were cooked to medium with herbs and a light buttery sauce. The bass flaked delicately and the scallops easily cut with a fork - both dishes melted in your mouth.  We also split 2 small sides - brussel sprouts and asparagus. The brussels were very tasty as they are cooked with bacon and shallots but I thought the asparagus was a bit over salted - perhaps that's why they serve it with a delicious hollandaise sauce on the side.    Dessert consisted of a typical chocolate lava cake served birthday style and on the house.  Things to consider:  The restaurant is quite dim - by design. The servers carry little flashlights in case you need help reading.  Parking at this location pretty much sucks.  They do valet, but if you're self-parking chances are you will be walking. For everything mentioned in the review(3 rounds of drinks) - $300+ otd.  To sum it up, Wildfish delivers on all fronts - ambiance, service, menu, plating, and taste.  But we all already knew that, right? :-)

Oysters wasn't fresh, but kungpao calamari and the cooked oyster( I forgot the name) is soooooo delicious! The entrees was good I had the hong kong style sea bass it was fresh and tasty and the server is really friendly.

Excellent food,  large variety and great service.   Lobster broiled and.sweetened to perfection.   The molten choc filled cake was an awesome end to dinner.  Expensive,  but to be expected for having great seafood in middle of desert. There were two waiters for my family of 4 and the service was impeccable.    Very expensive, but if you want to eat something special, be treated special, and for special occasions, this is the place.

I have been to Wildfish on a number of occasions and have always left with a smile on my face.  The food is to die for.  We always sit in the bar and take advantage of their happy hour specials. Happy hour is 7 days a week, Sun-Thursday from 4pm to close and Friday and Saturday 4-7. They have several cocktails avaiable for $6 (including cosmos, bacardi mojitios, el jimador magaritas, etc.) If those don't strike your fancy you also receive $2 off any of their specialty cocktails. There is also a special on wine, but I dont drink wine so I'm not sure what the discount is.  There are several appetizers available for $1O and other "small plates" available at discounted prices. And you don't have to sit at the bar itself, there are several booths available as well as two long tables that would sit at least 8 probably 10 people so great for am after work spot with your co-workers.                                                                                       Last night by husband and I arrived right as they opened at 4 pm.  We sat down at the bar top and were immediately greeted by a friendly, young gent named Eric.  While we always have a great exerience at Wildfish, this visit was the by far the best solely due to Erics excetional service.  He was very accomadating and made is feel at home. The man also makes an amazing Manhattan and a sectacular Cucumber Martini.  Anywho, we ordered a dozen oysters ($2 each) and their kung pao calamari to start. Oysters were juicy and delicous and the calamari was a heaping portion of calamari tossed with veggies and toasted cashews in a delectable kung pao sauce over a bed of crispy rice noodles.                                                                                                    Next round, we ordered the piece de resistance.  Their Crabcake.  It is the reason we make the trek from Glendale at least once a month. Light, fluffy and full of big ole' pieces of delectable crab meat.  It's served with a side of remolade and is big enough to share as an appetizer or order for a meal.  It is truly the best crab cake I have ever had.  We always order it with a side of their truffled mac and cheese.  Weird combo I know, but it works!                                                              While we do not usually order dessert I can tell you that everything on that menu is made in their pastry kitchen daily.  Two that stuck out where the "bananas foster" butter cake and the Godiva chocolate cake, both baked to order. They also do espresso and lattes.

Man I wish I could give 4.5 stars!   Food was 5/5 stars for sure. Everything was fresh and my Dad said his salmon was some of the best he has ever had (and boy has this man consumed a lot of salmon in his lifetime).  I had the seafood salad which I was amazing. I was surprised with how much seafood was actually included--very large pieces of fresh crab and huge shrimp. Good sized portions as well.  Our server took good care of us. The decor is upscale and comfortable. There is outdoor seating but if you don't request it with your reservation you aren't going to get it on a busy night. My only complaint was how loud it was during our dinner mostly from the music. Our party definitely had to speak up to be heard. I have had this same complaint at more than one restaurant in Scottsdale so I am beginning to think this is common in the more trendy areas of town.  Would go back for sure!!!

So I've eaten at this restaurant before. However, the other night we had a guest in from out of town and an event earlier in the evening. So we booked a reservation at this restaurant, WHICH THEY CONFIRMED.  When we walked into the restruant the place wasn't very busy and the greeter informed us that our reservation wasn't going to be honored, but, we were welcome to order a drink at the bar.  Because it was already after 9 at that point we had a difficult time finding a place that could accommodate us on such short notice.   Interestingly we didn't even have the latest reserved seating they were offering, there was one or two even later.   I eat out and entertain a lot for business and personal.  I rarely write totally negative reviews. But, Not honoring a reservation that a restaurant has not only taken but, have CONFIRMED just because the staff is lazy and wants to go home is completely unacceptable and shows a general lack of customer service and care for the client.  I do agree with an earlier reviewer.. If you want seafood go to mccormicks and schmicks or for a more local flare, The Salt Cellar.

I came here for the first time when I took my family visiting from KS here for my ASU graduation.  I thought the seafood was pretty good but there is definitely a few better places in the valley.  My family was really impressed with it though. I'm not sure if its because seafood restaurants are scarce in KS or if they really just loved it that much. I liked the dim lighting but the tables were really close together.  We had to wait awkwardly for a few minutes when we were trying to leave because we were blocked in by the trays of another table's food being delivered. Also I'm not sure where our server was from but his accent was really thick and it was really difficult to understand anything he said. Made it a little difficult to find out the specials. Overall I did enjoy it tho. I'd love to come back and try their happy hour. I hear its pretty good
This place has a great Happy Hour!! 4-7 each day and 4- close on Sunday and Mondays!!! The food is great and the bar is lively during HH. It's hard to go wrong here with anything...

Had drinks and apps here while waiting for a table next door. It was my first time here and we saddled up to the bar for about an hour or so. I tried two drinks (side car and red dragon?) which were not my go-to drinks but I did enjoy them. For apps we shared the Point Judith calamari and a noodle dish with tuna (can't find it on the menu now). The calamari was probably the best I have ever tried - very spicy (I love spicy) and fresh tasting. I also enjoyed the noodle dish, though I wish it had been as hot as the plate it was served on. Although I'm not a huge seafood person, their menu is attractive enough that I would stop in again.

The food and service were excellent. I would recommend a reservation on the weekends as the place had a 2 hour wait when I was there on a Saturday night. Our waiter was knowledgeable and enthusiastic.    The swordfish, mac & cheese, wine list, were all top notch. I was not too crazy about the green beans though.

It been a couple years since we've been back. Back again though for another Birthday celebration. We made reservations on Opentable for a Wednesday at 7:00 for a party of 3. We were greeted and seated right away. Our server for the evening introduced himself promptly, Everett.  We ordered drinks while perusing the menu. We had started off with Blue Point Oysters, Steak and Lobster Tartare. For entrees we had the Parmesan Lemon Sole, Pacific Ahi Tuna Tempura and the Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes. We ended the evening with a complimentary Birthday Creme Brulee. The food and service were excellent. A Birthday celebration well enjoyed.
Great place for seafood and fish lovers.  The crab cakes are to die for!The restaurant is beautiful and although it is quite a big place we did not find it too noisy.

Went Saturday night for Restaurant Week $44 menu again it was really good. The lobster and shrimp bisque was nice with a lovely warm bread and flavored butter. I had one glass of  chenin Blanc for $10. Florida grouper with lemon sauce and asparagus was unique because we don't get nice fresh fish like this to cook ourselves. Hubby enjoyed his well cooked filet and the brussel sprouts were delish with the bacon and shallots. Highlight is the Banana Foster flambe dessert with butter pecan ice cream so yummy carmely! Easy to park for free underneath and we had very good service.

I do not understand all of the good reviews of this restaurant. For the money it is really not good at all. The calamari dish was pretty tasteless. It is supposed to be spicy and have a lot of nuts and it was just a bunch of fried calamari on some noodles. I paid extra for sea bass with crab meat. It was so Bland you could have fed it to a two year old. My husband's dish was so salty he sent it back. Oh and get this the french fries were lousy. Can you imagine? They are better at almost  any fast food joint in the Valley. We had a decent bottle of wine and I can't complain about the service but really I would never go back and I would never suggest to anybody that they waste their money on this place.

This place is amazing. I made reservations on their website and specified that my wife and I were celebrating our anniversary. Our table had rose petals on it and an anniversary card that was signed by the staff. Peter was our server and was awesome. He was very proper yet normal and down to earth, which is good since we aren't Scottsdale folk. We started with a bottle of wine, a half dozen oysters, and the crab cake. The oysters were by far the best I've ever had. My wife has always been intrigued by oysters but too scared to try them since the consistency looks like mucus. Peter helped me talk her in to trying one and lo and behold she immediately loved them. The crab cake was also incredible as it was about 98% crab with some seasoning sprinkled on top, rather than half crab and half some other stuff. We ordered a bowl of the Lobster Bisque for the second course and it was awesome. My wife chose the sole for her main dish and I chose the scallops. The sides are all served a la carte, so we chose the broccolini, spinach, and au gratin potatoes. The scallops were the best I've ever had and my wife loved the sole. Lastly, we were given a complimentary dessert of our choice for our anniversary, so we chose the bananas foster. Incredible. It was flambéed at our table which cartelized the outside of the butter cake, making the outside a little crisp but also chewy like candy. It was so good. Everything was incredible and the service was amazing. I highly recommend this place for special occasions. Thanks Peter and all the rest of the Wildfish staff.

Wonderful Happy Hour, as most of their appetizers and drinks are half off.  They have the best crab fried in the nation!  Ambience is hip and young, with many of the local Scottsdale people in for their meal, as well as visitors to the area. Décor is modern Asian, with a twist of contemporary.  Nice open space, good for large groups, but expect long wait times

I have not been overly impressed with Wildfish either time I have been there. It is incredibly spendy and the atmosphere/food don't really justify the prices.  Happy hour is decent, but good luck fighting the grey hairs for a spot at the bar.   Last week I had a major craving for raw oysters, went to WF for happy hour where the oysters are only .75 a piece. Jesse the bartender is rad, but he shamefully explained they were out of oysters. WTF!!!!!!! I drove all the way from central Phoenix during rush hour to slurp down a dozen. How could they be out of all oysters at 5pm on a Monday!  I'll probably go back because when they have them they are out of this world. Next time I'll have to call ahead to make sure they put a dozen aside for me.

I just had to give this place the 5 stars....because I love that Chilean sea bass!!!!! Like I would go to bed with that bass and day dream all day!  So yummy and quite delicious and just hot off the press. It really looked beautiful in white and sitting atop some spinach and then settled in like an island in a puddle of light soy sauce broth - Hong Kong style.  The last time I had it in this version was meh.  So this days chef was on point.  I haven't had a really good Chilean sea bass in awhile. So when I do have one, you guys need to know what I'm talking about. It is listed as MKT price FYI.  I was able to slice the sea bass with my knife in one motion and each cut came out Mr. Clean!   I did utilize a pair of chopsticks ...I mean why not.  A delicate fish handled well. Everything was gone on that plate except for the ginger pieces.   The competitor: the Alaskan sable fish. This one was just as fantastic..more firm with a nice miso glaze. Shitake mushrooms and snap peas meddled into the affair - sweet and savory together.   Well not to discount the other things I had, but the Judith Point calamari was I guess also on point! Ha! Kung pao style made it a bit spicy for me, but I'm weak sauce. But great texture and not chewy at all!   A half dozen mix of west coast oysters will have you cry at $4 a piece. But what can I say - it's brine time. Still yummy!  And last but not least, butterscotch Panama cotta. I was wanting something chocolate-y, but I opted for something out of the ordinary. It came with biscotti, which made it look pretty but I found it to be unnecessary and not as complementing to the dessert. Maybe because it was in the "stale" stage. But the creaminess of the dessert and the caramel mounted on top did its job. I continued to eat most of it....as usual! Sigh!   Well, until then I'll just dream. But you should def try their fish options!

When I dine out, the experience we had last night at Wild fish, is exactly what I hope for. Lovely space, efficient and friendly service (thanks Nico!), amazing drinks and food. The oysters were fresh and delicious and the lobster bisque was the best I've ever had. Looking forward to many return visits.

Met friends for dinner there tonight.  I had the lump crab appetizer which was okay followed by the Ceasar salad. My friend requested no croutons and extra anchovies and we both got a slab of lettuce with no croutons and no anchovies. When i asked the waiter for the anchovies he asked what kind we wanted. Really? How many different types are there? Anyway, i ordered the scallops for the main course and without a doubt the worse scallops I've ever had.  Chalky, milky texture with no sear and a slice of grapefruit on top with an over-powering citrus taste. Couldn't eat them.  This place is pretentious and overpriced with subpar food. Won't be coming back.

Seafood in AZ?  Isn't that like Chicago style pizza in Hawaii?  No. We hit this place up on the 4th of July, while all the other touristos were down getting blitzed in Tempe, and it was amazing. They had great specials, good oysters rockefeller, good steaks, and we all left totally stuffed.   If you are looking for a decent seafood spot (that isn't sushi) give this joint a whirl.

Very classy ambience. They have a huge wine collection. You can tell by looking at the wine shelf. The staffs here are friendly. Even the on-training waiter looks very professional.  Everything under oyster bar section in the menu is a must try. Chilean sea bass is quite unique. I also had 2 lobster tails, and they are huge. They're a bit pricey tho ($88), and the second piece wasn't hot anymore after I finished the first one (I eat faster than most people). But they are delicious, 5 stars.
Love, love, love this place.  I'm a regular here and go for thir excellent food and happy hour.  Lobster bisque for $6 and drinks or $5.   Service is excellent.  This place rocks!

Let's get the nitty gritty out of the way.  Are they expensive? Yes. Will you leave full? Depends.  Is it worth it? Not for most.   With that said,  the ambience of this place was awesome.  Definitely a place that will impress anyone.  A bit on the pricey side.  Quality of the food is superb but i wouldnt say it's completely worth it because of the portion size.  Would have been nice to have some carbs to go with my swordfish.  I'd even settle for some veggies. They do give you free bread and butter upon sitting though.   We started the night off with some west coast oysters and jumbo lump crab cakes.  They do offer a variety of oysters which was nice but for the money,  I can't see why one couldn't settle for some nice blue points for a fraction of the cost.  We decided to try the totten and although they were delicious, at $24 for 1/2 dozen oyster, too expensive for my taste.   Crab cake was delicious and definitely worth a try if not anything else.   Portion size was enough for the two of us to share.   For dinner,  I ordered the swordfish and my fiance the Mediterranean branzino.  Both came out amazing but as stated above,  seemed like it was missing something.  A smidge of wild rice or veggies maybe? A few carrots? Something! Portion size aside,  the food was fresh and tasted great,  just pricey.   We both enjoyed some nice spirits during dinner. I ordered the Tokyo gimlet and she had the boozy Vietnamese coffee.  My drink was very refreshing with a slice of cucumber in the drink and well balanced with the alcohol while hers, although very uniquely done with coffee ice cubes, leaves more of a bitter taste on the tongue.  A little bit sweeter would have made that drink perfect. Maybe add some condense milk like the real vietnamese coffee?  Overall,  great place to try if you're nearby looking for a more upscale dinner.  Somewhere to splurge for a special occasion.  If price is the issue,  culinary dropouts is located next door as well

Great service and fantastic food!  They do not stiff on portions here.  My hubby and I had the calamari appetizer, FUJI apple salad, small side of brussel sprouts, crab fried rice, main dishes were Chilean sea bass and the sole dish.  To compliment the meal we also had a bottle of Proseccco and the bananas foster for desert.  Better believe we packed it to go and will savor the rest later.  EXCELLENT!!!

This is a lovely but pricey restaurant.  I came here about a week ago for the first time for a family dinner and they offered a 3 course fixed price menu for $25, which is a very good deal (considering if you ordered from the regular menu, one entree can cost you $25).    I started off with the salad with apples and walnuts.  The apples were slide VERY thinly and laid out beautifully in a fan-like shape.  The salad was fresh and the walnut provided a nice crunch.  There were also some sort of dried fruit in there which was a sweet surprise.  I had the halibut for my entree, but I wasn't very hungry so I didn't touch much of it.  My mom had the Hong Kong style sea bass, which was MUCH better than my halibut.  Her sea bass had this silky texture, almost like tofu, and the light sauce provided just the right amount of flavoring for the fish.  We finished off splitting a creme brulee, which was probably one of the best I've ever tried.  I'm not a huge fan of the hard candied layer on the top, but what was underneath had this nice dense texture and was just the right amount of creaminess.  One dish that is the highlight of our meal was the crab fried rice.  It was SOOO delicious, even better than the awesome sea bass.  We all found ourselves continuously reaching for the fried rice despite the fact that none of us had finished our actual entrees.  We loved it so much that we decided to order another to take home, and it still tasted great the second day.  One complaint: I barely touched my halibut that night and asked the waiter to wrap it up for me.  My fish came with a bed of rice and sauce and a bit of veggies, but when I got home and took out the fish, it was JUST THE FISH.  I was very upset, because without the sauce and the rice, how am I supposed to enjoy the whole dish? The fish would taste very dry.  And also I had paid for the whole thing, he had no right to throw part of my dinner away! So make sure when you ask for something to go, double check with them that they actually wrapped the WHOLE THING up for you.  Long review short: Get the crab fried rice.  Make sure you get your whole dish to go.

Are you vegetarian?  Have vegan friends? Find yourself in constant turmoil? Do you need yet another reason to explain why you'll never be vegan?  Well, look no further. A side order of truffle mac and cheese ($9 sm / $13 lg) and a bananas foster butter cake dessert ($11) will shut them up forever.  Macaroni is baked nicely and covered in flavorful creamy cheese. Topped with shavings of truffles and cheesy flavored breadcrumbs. Great texture and bite. Not too salty or gooey.  The bananas foster holds no bars. Soft butter cake topped with large banana slices and caramel sauce and accompanied with a delicious scoop of butter pecan ice cream and dollop of whipped cream.   Once the dessert gets flambéed, the entire table silences and watches in awe as it metamorphoses into the best dessert EVER and everyone leans in to see the blue flame finally settle down and then flicker out. Then everyone digs in for a bite of hot-sticky-creamy-cake-banana-sauce-cream mess.  Side effects include euphoria, satisfaction, and bliss. If you find yourself with a sugar-high, guiltiness, or feelings of over-eating consult your doctor immediately.

Had a salad and wife had tuna poke and it was really good.  The poke wasn't anything like in Hawaii, but above average.  For dinner I had the Seared Ahi Tuna and was cooked perfectly and quite a huge thick piece, and my wife had the Chilean Sea bass which she said was delicious.  The chefs took over 20 minutes to get our salads out and so the waiter apologized and then comped us a dessert which was delicious.  The place was expensive but reasonable for the quality and amount of food you receive.  I will try the happy hour next time I am in town to see what the fuss is about.  Sounds fun.
Great food and the service was attentive. Super tasty meal. I had the oysters on the half shell, lobster bisque, and scallops. I would definitely recommend.

I live in Maryland but loved this place, its a real gem. We went on a Saturday night, the place was buzzing but you notice from the first moment to the last that the service is top class, really top class. They didn't rush us and they made us feel really welcome. The wine list is excellent and our waiter, Raul was very knowledgeable. He knew the menu inside out and picked a terrific wine for the meal. This place is perfect for any date night or an occasion when you want to impress. Bets of all, they aren't that expensive. If that was here in the DC are it would be ridiculously priced. Brilliant.

Classy, sassy, with a dash of salt.  Wildfish is the place to be during happy hours.  Their appetizers are phenomenal and out of this world.  Fresh oysters, fried calamari and some wagyu beef.  Wag what!? Wagyu stupid - Wiki it!  Their selection of wine is always a delight and service is bolting fast.  I think it helps when they're all dressed like penguins; there's so many! - awwe so cute though :)  The ambience is so chill with a nice touch of a lounge.  Happy Hours all day Monday so push that "case of the Mundays" aside! - Enjoy

Im usually a fan of the Fox Concepts restaurants but Wildfish really doesnt live up to their usually good service and accommodating nature.  My request to have a vegetarian plate prepared was flat out denied (not a problem at the other Fox restaurants that go out of their way to work with me!) and I was encouraged to "eat the sides".  As we were sitting outside finishing our meal they shut off the heaters-in the middle of winter!  I guess they were ready to have us leave even though they had delivered the other guests meals only about 15 minutes prior.  From what I understand the entrees my guests had were excellent but even they were astonished by how we were treated.

Very good restaurant! The service was first class from the moment we walked in the door to the moment we walked back out the door. The atmosphere was very nice as well. It was lit perfectly and the sound level was just right. Very neat neon lit signs around the bar just to add a bit of character to the place.The steak is, in my humble opinion, one of the best I've had in the Phoenix metro area next to my personal favorite, The Keg. Very expensive for my taste but well worth the dining experience if you don't mind spending a bit. To give a good idea, you will spend apx $200 (or more) for two people to dine. Again, very good service and steak.

I finally made it back to Wildfish for dinner. I would have given it a 5 star ratting if they hadn't taken my wine of the menu.... Yo! Person in charge of the wine, put Mark West back please!   Went to dinner a few weeks ago, looking for some good seafood that wouldn't put me in the poor house, we choose well. The wine was decently priced, the wedge salad I started with was great (anything with bacon is great), the crab cake my date had was very good as well. Then we had the Salmon and parm-crusted Sol for dinner. I thought both were excellent. My sol was the top dish of the evening for sure, probably best fish I have ever had out. Try it! We were too full to try desert but they all sounded good.   The service was very good; didn't linger too long and never had to seek him out. Two very enthusiastic thumbs up!

Celebrating Thanksgiving and our anniversary tonight! What a delicious meal ,the bread stuffing,squash, turkey and all the trimmings.....so good! Service was outstanding everyone made sure we had what we needed.  Then the complementary bananas foster desert,  wow!! Thank you Wildfish for making our anniversary dinner extra special tonight. Great job by all.

Wildfish is fantastic...the service was excellent only surpassed by the quality of food. My wife and I love the scallops and their shrimp cocktail is a classic but fantastic! We made a reservation and they take the time to pass your name to team so you always addressed as "Mr and Mrs XYZ"...makes you feel special like a visiting political VIP or something! The place is beautiful and I highly recommend it! SO TASTY!

My boyfriend and I were in town for Spring Training and he was craving seafood. After searching, this popped up and it's easy to see why.   The ambience was relaxing and just what we needed for our last night in Scottsdale. Service was impeccable. I believe we had a server named Kyle...(I could be mistaking). He guided us in the right direction of what to get and proportions. He was very friendly and kept us full on water & our delicious cocktails. The food is also so great, I'm not the biggest seafood fan but got the potstickers and scallops. Both amazing! Great dining experience.

What a great Happy Hour!  We stopped in at 5 on a Friday and it was jammed.  The hostesses were very gracious and gave us a nice table since the bar was jammed. The crowd was loud, stylish and very friendly.  We ordered four appetizers, all of which were excellent.  The two most noteworthy were the crab cake which was both huge and just incredibly delicious and an unbelievable steal at $6.00 and the chopped salad that was so big the waiter had to split it onto two plates.  Again, about $6.00. We had some ahi sashimi thing that was very nice and a shrimp cocktail that was the least impressive of the lot.    The drinks were excellent and the service was outstanding : professional, quick and very friendly.  Very nice selection of wines by the glass too.  We rolled out of there stuffed and very satisfied with the entire experience.  Can't wait to go back for dinner.  Highly recommended!

We started with drinks- it was Sunday so there was all day happy hour and discounted appetizers.  We had a Dragon Berry Mojitos and Citrus Mist Martinis.  AMAZING.  The martini ranks up there with some of the best drinks we have ever had.  Our waiter, Josh Porvin, did an excellent job keeping our drinks coming and the timing for the entire meal was great!  We ordered the crab and shrimp potsickers for an appetizer.  The sauce they were served in was excellent, and they were just very tasty.  For our main course we followed the advice of many yelpers before and ordered the stuffed jumbo shrimp.  These shrimp were some of the largest we had ever seen.  Each bite was so rich and delicious.  The bacon was crisp and goat cheese was creamy.  What else can you ask for?  In addition to the entree, which we shared, we ordered a side of the crab fried rice.  Talk about delicious.  Josh recommended it when we couldn't decide what side dish we wanted and he didn't steer us wrong.  Over all this was the best meal of our entire trip to Arizona.  The service was fantastic and food was flawless.  If you go to Wildfish ask for Josh Porvin- he'll hook you up!

Had a nice dinner with friends at Wildfish. Had raw oysters to start.  They were fresh and hit the spot.  The meal of both shrimp and a filet okay.  Everything we had was cooked nicely and the food was fresh.  The atmosphere is nice.  Most impressive was our server, Nico. He was excellent.  He knew his stuff from top to bottom, was very accommodating which how each person wanted their particular order, and didn't miss one beat the entire evening.  I have to say, I received the best service from him this entire year from any restaurant from the east coast to the west coast this year.  The main reason for my review was the service.
Normally a great place for seafood. Most recent dining was very ordinary as it took 3 times for the cook to get one of our meals correct. And that included manager intervention twice.

This place is great! Every time I have been there it has been on the money! From appetizers to entrees to the wine list just really good. Everything I have had is excellent but my favorite is the Chilean Sea Bass. But had Sword Fish, Scallops, just go. Go treat your ladies fellas.

Sorry, Catch 35. You have been topped by Wildfish. Well, topped is actually quite mild. This was more along the lines of the first Packers-Cardinals game of the 2015 season.  The level of service at Wildfish literally decimated Catch 35 on all levels.  The server's product knowledge was excellent right down to even suggesting wine pairings with our meal. However, if you are planning to eat here on a budget, good luck with that. The dinner we had was $77 including an appetizer, salad, chicken breast, side (sides are a la carte) and dessert.  A steak alone is $52+.  Speaking of the chicken breast, many places normally serve it too dry and it has me grabbing my water FAST.  Not here.  This was the most succulent and tender chicken breast I have EVER eaten in my entire life.  Plus, you get two huge ones for the price. The sauteed beets were beyond divine.  The desserts were so good that I was looking for the pastry chef so I could shake his/her hand.  Wildfish has now become my reference standard to compare all other restaurants.

Kevin was an excellent waitperson, thanks Kevin! We just finished a hike up on one of the local mountains. After we came down we wanted to get some yummy food for our 20th Anniversary so we decided to give the Wildfish Seafood Grill a try. The Wagyu ribeye was excellent and so was the Australian white fish.... thanks Wildfish, that was a great dinner :-) thanks also for the yummy cheesecake for desert!
Amazing food! I recommend the salmon. Delicious! Everything was wonderful! !! Their dining room was booked but they have bar area tables which are open seating.

Ate at Wildfish this evening.  My wife had a really nice salad.  I ordered the fried oysters (good) and the Asian BBQ Salmon (sauce hid the taste of salmon completely.  Service was very good.  Atmosphere was dark.  Overall overpriced.

We made a reservation for our anniversary and everything was amazing. Every server individually wished us a happy anniversary. The food was perfectly cooked and packed with flavor. The only down side was the price, but we were expecting it. Dinner for two with one alcoholic beverage each, plus an appetizer was $200, including tip.

Wow!!! Shockingly bad...this is in comparison of Eddie V's in kierland. Identical menu...identical happy hour menu...same company...but taste like a completely different kitchen...I was pretty shocked!! I actually did not know they were Eddie V's sister restaurant until I saw the menu!! Since we have eaten at Eddie v's maybe 40 times or so...0Started with red dragon drink and inflection cabinet, reasonable for the price. Then had 10 west coast oysters from Washington, called capital...biggest west coast oysters i have ever had!! Rich and creamy...amazing...then the food arrived and went down hill. The lamb lollipops were terrible compared to Eddie V's...you can tell same recipe but made horribly...then had salt and pepper shrimp...again resemble same recipe but not as tasty, not as crunchy, disappointing...then had lobster and crab wonton. I really have nothing good to say about the wonton...and finally had blacken fish tacos...at Eddie v's you are drooling after eating and then here, yuck...so realistically, drive the 15 minute to kierland to have one of the best seafood experiences ever!! Here I would never recommend my enemies to come...

I attended a Yelp Elite event here and I was completely wowed by the seafood.  Having lived and spent time in various places on the water I have diminished expectations for seafood now that I live in the desert.    Fear not!  I will be back here on the oysters alone!  Much less the jumbo shrimp, fresh tuna and crab cakes.    The last time I was this impressed with crab cakes I could smell the Atlantic.  The last time I had such good oysters I could smell the Pacific.

This place looks unique and fun. Food was ok and service was slow.  Came in with a huge group and we all fitted so comfortably except everything was ...... Well let's say they don't know how to service big parties that's has a lot of guest.  food was cold, service on drinks was very very slow....

I love this place for Happy Hour.  Amazing prices and Oyster's that are the best I have ever had in AZ!  I go super early with my hubby and have referred others there as well.  Great professional staff and love how open it is.
Great service. Food was a good quality.  The pot stickers were ok. I was a little disappointed.

First day here in Scottdale and I choose this place to eat at for lunch, and I am glad I did. I ordered the Lobster tacos and fried rice with crabmeat. It was sooooo good... I would definitely go back!!

Fantastic! The food and service were great. I had the tempura ahi tuna and my husband had the jumbo Shrimp. Both were so delicious. For an anniversary dessert they gave us the creamed brûlée. Wow the best I've ever had. Highly recommend.

Service was good, food was average, I ordered the sea bass and it was nothing extraordinary neither the scallops. Since there are so many choices around the area, at their price tag, we won't be going back.
Mediocre food and overall experience. Definately go for happy hour, 1/2 price menu, but that's about the only reason I go back now.

I just love this place.   Great atmosphere, great cocktails, and wonderful happy hour snacks. Very reasonable pricing too.  Been to happy hour here a few times -- I had dinner here for the first time recently and was blown away.  One of the best deals in Scottsdale (and close to all the action of old town).
